New Records: Sri Lanka bowled out for 77, their lowest total in T20I history
Sri Lanka's score of 77 is the fifth-lowest by a full-member team in T20 World Cup history
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 7 runs, leading South Africa's disciplined bowling
Ottneil Baartman claimed a wicket with his very first delivery and maintained an impressive economy rate of 2.25
Keshav Maharaj took two wickets in consecutive balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York pitch, being used for the first time in this tournament, proved challenging for the batsmen with inconsistent bounce and swing
Sri Lanka managed just three fours and three sixes in 19.1 overs
